refsect2.title: gimp_prop_boolean_combo_box_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_boolean_combo_box_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, const gchar *true_text, const gchar *false_text);
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkComboBox widget to display and set the specified boolean property. The combo box will have two entries, one displaying the true_text label, the other displaying the false_text label.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of boolean property controlled by combo box.
Label used for entry corresponding to TRUE value.
Label used for entry corresponding to FALSE value.

The newly created GtkComboBox widget, optionally wrapped into a GtkEventBox..
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_boolean_radio_frame_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_boolean_radio_frame_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, const gchar *title, const gchar *true_text, const gchar *false_text);
refsect2.para: Creates a pair of radio buttons which function to set and display the specified boolean property.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of boolean property controlled by the radio buttons.
Label for the frame.
Label for the button corresponding to TRUE.
Label for the button corresponding to FALSE.

A GimpFrame containing the radio buttons.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_check_button_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkCheckButton that displays and sets the specified boolean property.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of boolean property controlled by checkbutton.
Label to give checkbutton (including mnemonic).

The newly created GtkCheckButton widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_color_area_new ()

Name of RGB property.

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_coordinates_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_coordinates_new (GObject *config, const gchar *x_property_name, const gchar *y_property_name, const gchar *unit_property_name, const gchar *unit_format, GimpSizeEntryUpdatePolicy update_policy, gdouble xresolution, gdouble yresolution, gboolean has_chainbutton);
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpSizeEntry to set and display two double or int properties, which will usually represent X and Y coordinates, and their associated unit property.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of int or double property for X coordinate.
Name of int or double property for Y coordinate.
Name of unit property.
A printf-like unit-format string as is used with gimp_unit_menu_new().
How the automatic pixel <-> real-world-unit calculations should be done.
The resolution (in dpi) for the X coordinate.
The resolution (in dpi) for the Y coordinate.
Whether to add a chainbutton to the size entry.

A new GimpSizeEntry widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_entry_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkEntry to set and display the value of the specified string property.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of string property.
Maximum allowed length of string.

A new GtkEntry widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_enum_check_button_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_enum_check_button_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, const gchar *label, gint false_value, gint true_value);
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkCheckButton that displays and sets the specified property of type Enum. Note that this widget only allows two values for the enum, one corresponding to the "checked" state and the other to the "unchecked" state.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of enum property controlled by checkbutton.
Label to give checkbutton (including mnemonic).
Enum value corresponding to unchecked state.
Enum value corresonding to checked state.

The newly created GtkCheckButton widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_enum_combo_box_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_enum_combo_box_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, gint minimum, gint maximum);
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpIntComboBox widget to display and set the specified enum property. The mimimum_value and maximum_value give the possibility of restricting the allowed range to a subset of the enum. If the two values are equal (e.g., 0, 0), then the full range of the Enum is used.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of enum property controlled by combo box.
Smallest allowed value of enum.
Largest allowed value of enum.

The newly created GimpEnumComboBox widget, optionally wrapped into a GtkEventBox.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_enum_label_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_enum_label_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name);

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of enum property to be displayed.

The newly created GimpEnumLabel widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_enum_radio_box_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_enum_radio_box_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, gint minimum, gint maximum);
refsect2.para: Creates a group of radio buttons which function to set and display the specified enum property. The minimum and maximum arguments allow only a subset of the enum to be used. If the two arguments are equal (e.g., 0, 0), then the full range of the enum will be used. If you want to assign a label to the group of radio buttons, use gimp_prop_enum_radio_frame_new() instead of this function.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of enum property controlled by the radio buttons.
Smallest value of enum to be included.
Largest value of enum to be included.

A GtkVBox containing the radio buttons.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_enum_radio_frame_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_enum_radio_frame_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, const gchar *title, gint minimum, gint maximum);
refsect2.para: Creates a group of radio buttons which function to set and display the specified enum property. The minimum and maximum arguments allow only a subset of the enum to be used. If the two arguments are equal (e.g., 0, 0), then the full range of the enum will be used.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of enum property controlled by the radio buttons.
Label for the frame holding the buttons
Smallest value of enum to be included.
Largest value of enum to be included.

A GimpFrame containing the radio buttons.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_enum_stock_box_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_enum_stock_box_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, const gchar *stock_prefix, gint minimum, gint maximum);
refsect2.para: Creates a horizontal box of radio buttons with stock icons, which function to set and display the value of the specified Enum property. The stock_id for each icon is created by appending the enum_value's nick to the given stock_prefix. See gimp_enum_stock_box_new() for more information.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of enum property controlled by the radio buttons.
The prefix of the group of stock ids to use.
Smallest value of enum to be included.
Largest value of enum to be included.

A GimpEnumStockBox containing the radio buttons.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_expander_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkExpander controlled by the specified boolean property. A value of TRUE for the property corresponds to the expanded state for the widget.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of boolean property.
Label for expander.

A new GtkExpander widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_file_chooser_button_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_file_chooser_button_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, const gchar *title, GtkFileChooserAction action);
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkFileChooserButton to edit the specified path property.
Note that GtkFileChooserButton implements the GtkFileChooser interface; you can use the GtkFileChooser API with it.

listitem.simpara: object to which property is attached.
name of path property.
the title of the browse dialog.
the open mode for the widget.

A new GtkFileChooserButton.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_file_chooser_button_new_with_dialog ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_file_chooser_button_new_with_dialog (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, GtkWidget *dialog);
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkFileChooserButton to edit the specified path property.
The button uses dialog as it's file-picking window. Note that dialog must be a GtkFileChooserDialog (or subclass) and must not have GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT set.
Note that GtkFileChooserButton implements the GtkFileChooser interface; you can use the GtkFileChooser API with it.

listitem.simpara: object to which property is attached.
name of path property.
the GtkFileChooserDialog widget to use.

A new GtkFileChooserButton.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_int_combo_box_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpIntComboBox widget to display and set the specified property. The contents of the widget are determined by store, which should be created using gimp_int_store_new().

Name of int property controlled by combo box.
GimpIntStore holding list of labels, values, etc.

The newly created GimpIntComboBox widget, optionally wrapped into a GtkEventBox.

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_label_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_label_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name);
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkLabel to display the value of the specified property. The property should be a string property or at least transformable to a string. If the user should be able to edit the string, use gimp_prop_entry_new() instead.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of string property.

A new GtkLabel widget.

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_memsize_entry_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_memsize_entry_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name);
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpMemsizeEntry (spin button and option menu) to set and display the value of the specified memsize property. See gimp_memsize_entry_new() for more information.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of memsize property.

A new GimpMemsizeEntry.

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_opacity_entry_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkObject* gimp_prop_opacity_entry_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, GtkTable *table, gint column, gint row, const gchar *label);
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpScaleEntry (slider and spin button) to set and display the value of the specified double property, which should represent an "opacity" variable with range 0 to 100. See gimp_scale_entry_new() for more information.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of double property controlled by the spin button.
The GtkTable the widgets will be attached to.
The column to start with.
The row to attach the widgets.
The text for the GtkLabel which will appear left of the GtkHScale.

The GtkSpinButton's GtkAdjustment.
Since GIMP 2.4

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_scale_entry_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkObject* gimp_prop_scale_entry_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, GtkTable *table, gint column, gint row, const gchar *label, gdouble step_increment, gdouble page_increment, gint digits, gboolean limit_scale, gdouble lower_limit, gdouble upper_limit);
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpScaleEntry (slider and spin button) to set and display the value of the specified double property. See gimp_scale_entry_new() for more information.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of double property controlled by the spin button.
The GtkTable the widgets will be attached to.
The column to start with.
The row to attach the widgets.
The text for the GtkLabel which will appear left of the GtkHScale.
Step size.
Page size.
Number of digits after decimal point to display.
TRUE if the range of possible values of the GtkSpinButton should be the same as of the GtkHScale.
The spinbutton's lower boundary if limit_scale is FALSE.
The spinbutton's upper boundary if limit_scale is FALSE.

The GtkSpinButton's GtkAdjustment.

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_size_entry_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gimp_prop_size_entry_new (GObject *config, const gchar *property_name, gboolean property_is_pixel, const gchar *unit_property_name, const gchar *unit_format, GimpSizeEntryUpdatePolicy update_policy, gdouble resolution);
refsect2.para: Creates a GimpSizeEntry to set and display the specified double or int property, and its associated unit property. Note that this function is only suitable for creating a size entry holding a single value. Use gimp_prop_coordinates_new() to create a size entry holding two values.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of int or double property.
When TRUE, the property value is in pixels, and in the selected unit otherwise.
Name of unit property.
A printf-like unit-format string as is used with gimp_unit_menu_new().
How the automatic pixel <-> real-world-unit calculations should be done.
The resolution (in dpi) for the field.

A new GimpSizeEntry widget.
Since GIMP 2.4

Name of double property controlled by the spin button.
Step size.
Page size.

column in store that holds string IDs

refsect2.title: gimp_prop_text_buffer_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkTextBuffer to set and display the value of the specified string property. Unless the string is expected to contain multiple lines or a large amount of text, use gimp_prop_entry_new() instead. See GtkTextView for information on how to insert a text buffer into a visible widget.
If max_len is 0 or negative, the text buffer allows an unlimited number of characters to be entered.

listitem.simpara: Object to which property is attached.
Name of string property.
Maximum allowed length of text (in characters).

A new GtkTextBuffer.
Since GIMP 2.4

A new GimpUnitMenu widget.
Since GIMP 2.4
